thread.title: Incredible images of the world's most extreme rush hours
thread.title_full: Incredible images of the world's most extreme rush hours | Daily Mail Online

author: Georgia Diebelius For Mailonline
title: Incredible images of the world's most extreme rush hours
text:
109 shares 5
View
comments
Rush hours around the world have one thing in common - they're all busy.
But they don't all look the same.
These incredible pictures show how the transport used - and the conditions - can vary enormously from country to country.
In India a rush hour journey can be teeming with cows, goats and rickshaws. In Tokyo the trains are so busy that staff are employed to push people into the carriages.
In Hue City, Vietnam, meanwhile, thousands of commuters take to motorbikes and charge en masse to their places of work.
Here MailOnline Travel reveals images of the most extreme rush hours, events that as a tourist you may well want to steer clear of.
Scroll down for video
Get moo-ving: Cattle on the highway often cause traffic jams in Chattisgadh, India, during rush hour
In busy Tokyo stations there are dedicated 'train pushers' on each platform who work to force passengers into crowded carriages during rush hour
It often takes several officers to force the doors to close during the busy period with passengers suffering horrific conditions
The rush hour conditions leave absolutely no room for dignity. Pictured is a well-dressed businessman being unceremoniously shoved in

Bicycles, scooters and motorbikes queue up in rush hour traffic at Angkor Wat in Siem Reap, Cambodia
Passengers disembark at King's Cross station during peak times. Commuters are pushed together as they make their way towards the exit
At Chhatrapati Shivaji Train Station in Mumbai India, the crowds that gather for rush hour trains are regularly enormous

Pictured: The 20-year-old tourist killed by a box jellyfish... 109 shares Traffic fills the city of Jaipur in Rajasthan, India. A sea of colourful clothing and vehicles fills the busy streets
Goat out the way: These animals regularly cause serious traffic jams during rush hour between Pokhara and Nayapul in Nepal, Asia
Boat coming through: A long trail of tourist transport boats and gondoliers fill Venice's Grand Canal during peak times
The Old Taxi Park in Kampala, Uganda, is chaotic. Small buses based here transport passengers in all directions
Passengers queue up to board a subway train at a metro station during rush hour in Beijing, China. The average journey to work for Beijing commuters in 2013 was 11 miles
Not-so-easy riding: Commuters on motorcycles are pictured here crossing Trang Tien Bridge in Hue city, Vietnam
Commuters are seen making their way through the packed commercial street in the southern Indian city of Bangalore
The easiest way to travel? This busy road in Dhaka, Bangladesh, is packed with colourful rickshaws during peak times
Peak hour in one of Kathmandu's streets. Workers can be seen travelling by foot and car in a bid to get from A to B
Rush hour in the Barra Funda metro station, Barra Funda, São Paulo, Brazil, sees commuters line up before rushing onto the train
Yellow Kolkata taxis outside Howrah Railway Station in the morning rush hour in Calcutta
